Andrew P. Moratzka  
Stoel Rives LLP  
33 S Sixth Street, Suite 4200  
Minneapolis, MN 55402  
 
Re: In the Matter of the Petition of Minnesota Power for the Acquisition of ALLETE 
by Canada Pension Plan Investment Board and Global Infrastructure Partners  
MPUC Docket Nos. E -015/PA -24-198 
  
Dear Mr. Moratzka:  
 
On July 14, 2025, the Large Power Intervenors served the Department of Commerce with 
discovery requests 500 through 504 in connection with the above -referenced matter . These 
requests, however, are untimely. The deadline for serving discovery was March 26, 2025. (First 
Prehearing Order ¶ 12.) Moreover, the Minnesota chapter 1400 rules that would otherwise permit 
LPI to engage in timely discovery are no longer applicable given that jurisdiction over the matter 
has returned to the Public Utilities Commission. See Minn. R. 1400.8300 ; Minn. Admin. Proc. § 
7.4.1 (3rd ed.). Finally, even if LPI’s  discovery was timely and permitted by the applicable rules , 
several questions attempt to obtain privileged work -product or otherwise inadmissible settlement 
communications . 
 
Although the Department will not be responding to LPI’s untimely discovery, the 
Department appreciates that there is great interest in the stipulation and questions about how the 
Settling Parties intend for various provisions to be construed. LPI, for example, asked the 
Department which stipulation provisions are new,  and which were previously proposed by 
Petitioners. That information can be found in footnote three of the stipulation . In another instance, 
LPI asked the Department about the composition of the post -Acquisition board. To clarify, the  
board will have fourteen  directors. The Partners will select ten directors based on their respective 
ownership  interests . The Partners will select three directors by agreement . The final director will 
be ALLETE’s CEO. Of the thirteen non -CEO directors, six of them will meet the NYSE’s 
definition of independence and the Partners will appoint the remaining seven directors to represent 
their respective interests  consistent with their fiduciary obligations to ALLETE under Minnesota 
law.  
 
If LPI has  other questions about the meaning of stipulation provisions, please contact me 
by telephone  or e-mail. While discovery is not permissible  at this point in the contested -case 
Andrew P. Moratzka  
July 1 8, 2025  
Page 2 
 
 proceeding, the Department is available to help other interested parties understand the provisions 
of the stipulation.  
 
Thank you for your attention to this matter.   
 
Sincerely,  
 
 
/s/ Richard Dornfeld

NOTICE OF COMMENT  PERIOD  ON THE PROPOSED SETTLEMENT  
Issued : July 18, 2025   
 
In the Matter of the Petition of Minnesota Power for Acquisition of ALLETE by Canada Pension 
Plan Investment Board and Global Infrastructure Partners  
 
PUC Docket Number (s):  E-015/PA -24-198 
OAH Docket Number:   25-2500 -40339   
 
Comment Period:    Initial Comment period closes on  August 4, 2025 at 4:30pm  
Reply Comment period closes on August 14, 2025 at 4:30 pm  
 
Comments received after the close of the comment period may or may not be considered by the Commission.  
 
Issue:   Is the proposed Settlement between the Department of Commerce and ALLETE consistent 
with the public interest?  
 
Topic (s) Open for Comment:   In addition to filing Exceptions to the ALJ Report, please provide 
comments on:  
• Is the proposed Settlement between the Department of Commerce and ALLETE consistent with the public interest within the meaning of Minn. Stat. § 216B.50?  
• Has the proposed Settlement addressed the questions addressed to the Administrative 
Law Judge in the Commission’s Order of October 7, 2024?  
• Does the Acquisition proposal as modified by the Settlement agreement provide 
appropriate protections to low- income customers and customers from marginalized 
communities?  
• Are there  conditions that should be imposed on this transaction in addition to those that 
were included in the settlement , and if so, what are those conditions?   Please describe the 
additional condition and support its inclusion.  
• Are there  other issues or concerns  related to this matter?  
 Please file Exceptions to the ALJ Report and Comments on the Settlement separately, if practical.  
 
Background  
On July 19, 2024, ALLETE, Inc., d/b/a Minnesota Power  (Minnesota Power or MP) submitted a 
Petition requesting approval of the acquisition of ALLETE by Canada Pension Plan Investment 
 
 
 
 
________________________________  
Mike Bull, Acting  Executive Secretary  
PUC Docket Number E-015/PA- 24-198   
 
2 | Page  
 Board and Global Infrastructure Partners (collectively, “the Partners”).  On October 7, 2024, the 
Public Utilities Commission of Minnesota (Commission) issued an order referring this Petition to 
the State Office of Administrative Hearings (OAH) for a conte sted case proceeding.  Administrative 
Law Judge (ALJ) Megan J. McKenzie held evidentiary hearings at the Commission offices on April 1 -
3, 2025, and issued a Proposal for Decision recommending denial of the petition on July 15, 2025.  
 On July 11, 2025, Minnesota Power, the Partners, and the Department of Commerce, Division of Energy Regulation (Department) filed a Settlement Stipulation for all issues in this case, which recommended approval with certain additional conditions. No other parties joined in this Settlement.  
 Consistent with Administrative Rule 7829.2700, the period for filing Exceptions to the ALJ Report 
closes on August 4, 2025, and Reply to Exceptions on August 14, 2025.   Comments on the 
Settlement will run coterminous with the Exceptions, but Exceptions should be filed separately.  
 
Filing Requirements:  Utilities, telecommunications carriers, official parties, and state agencies are 
required to efile documents using the Commission’s electronic filing system (eFiling). All parties, 
participants, and interested persons are encouraged to use eFiling at: 
https://www.edockets.state.mn.us/EFiling
 
 Submit Public Comments : 
Online :            https://mn.gov/puc/get- involved/public -comments/ , and follow the instructions . 
Email :              consumer.puc@state.mn.us  
U.S. Mail :        Consumer Affairs Office  
                          Minnesota Public Utilities Commission  
                          121 7th Place East, Suite 350  
                          St. Paul MN  55101   
Full Case Record :  See all documents filed in this matter on the Commission’s website at: 
mn.gov/puc/edockets , select Go to eDockets , enter 24-198 under Docket #s, and select Search.  
Subscribe : To receive email notification when new documents are filed in this matter visit: 
https://www.edockets.state.mn.us/EFiling  and select Subscribe to Dockets . 
 Questions  about this docket or Commission process and procedure ?  Contact  Commission staff,  
Robert Manning , at Robert.manning@state.mn.us  or 651-201-2197.  
 Change your mailing preferences:  Email docketing.puc@state.mn.us  or call Leesa Norton  at 651-
201-2246. 
 
To request this document in another format such as  large print or audio, call 651 -296-0406 (voice).  
Consumers with a hearing or speech impairment may call using their preferred Telecommunications 
Relay Service or email  consumer.puc@state.mn.us  for assistance.

NOTICE OF SCHEDULE FOR EXCEPTIONS TO THE ALJ REPORT  
Issued : July 18, 2025   
 
In the Matter of the Petition of Minnesota Power for Acquisition of ALLETE by Canada Pension 
Plan Investment Board and Global Infrastructure Partners  
 
PUC Docket Number (s):  E-015/PA -24-198 
OAH Docket Number:   25-2500 -40339   
 
Comment Period:    Exceptions due  August 4, 2025 at 4:30pm  
   Reply to Exceptions due  August 14, 2025 at 4:30pm  
 Comments received after the close of the comment period may or may not be considered by the Commission.  
 
Issue:  Are there any Exceptions to the ALJ Report?  
 
Topic (s) Open for Comment:    
• Are the findings of the Administrative Law Judge consistent with Minn. Stat. § 216B.50 and 
other Minnesota Statutes and Rules?  
• Should the Commission adopt or modify the ALJ Report, and if so, what modifications should the Commission make?  
• Are there  other issues or concerns  related to this matter?  
 
Background  On July 19, 2024, ALLETE, Inc., d/b/a Minnesota Power (Minnesota Power or MP) 
submitted a Petition requesting approval of the acquisition of ALLETE by Canada Pension Plan 
Investment Board and Global Infrastructure Partners (collectively, “the Partners”).  On October 7, 2024, the Public Utilities Commission of Minnesota (Commission) issued an order referring this 
Petition to the State Office of Administrative Hearings (OAH) for a contested case proceeding.  
Administrative Law Judge (ALJ) Megan J. McKenzie he ld evidentiary hearings at the Commission 
offices on April 1 -3, 2025, and issued a Proposal for Decision recommending denial of the petition 
on July 15, 2025.  
 On July 11, 2025, Minnesota Power, the Partners, and the Department of Commerce, Division of 
Energy Regulation (Department) filed a Settlement Stipulation for all issues in this case, which recommended approval with certain additional conditions. No other parties joined in this Settlement.

Settlement  filed by Minnesota Power and the Department of Commerce on July 11, 2025  will run 
coterminously with Exceptions, but Comments on the Settlement should be filed separately.  
 Filing Requirements:  Utilities, telecommunications carriers, official parties, and state agencies are 
required to efile documents using the Commission’s electronic filing system (eFiling). All parties, 
participants, and interested persons are encouraged to use eFiling at: https://www.edockets.state.mn.us/EFiling
 
 Submit Public Comments : 
Online :            https://mn.gov/puc/get- involved/public -comments/ , and follow the instructions . 
Email :              consumer.puc@state.mn.us  
U.S. Mail :        Consumer Affairs Office  
                          Minnesota Public Utilities Commission  
                          121 7th Place East, Suite 350  
                          St. Paul MN  55101   
Full Case Record :  See all documents filed in this matter on the Commission’s website at: 
mn.gov/puc/edockets , select Go to eDockets , enter 24-198 under Docket #s, and select Search.  
Subscribe : To receive email notification when new documents are filed in this matter visit: 
https://www.edockets.state.mn.us/EFiling  and select Subscribe to Dockets . 
 Questions  about this docket or Commission process and procedure ?  Contact  Commission staff,

The sale of Minnesota Power would take the company completely into private hands. No public utilities should
EVER be placed in private hands. This will cause services to decline and rates to increase, it ALWAYS does. The
fact that this is even being consider is criminal. If anything Minnesota Power should be sold to the State of
Minnesota and run by a publicly elected and accountable board. That should be the case with ALL utilities, and
phone/internet services ARE utilities too. No way should these sorts of things be left in the hands of greedy
private companies who use them to enrich themselves while exploiting citizens. You should find it shameful you
need to be told this, but that's where we are as a society I guess, you have to tell the government it's wrong for
them to let companies fuck them over. Who do you work for 'we the people', or the American oligarchs?

To whom it may concern,
It distresses myself and my family greatly, the thought of our public utility Minnesota Power owned by the Allete
Co. to be sold to a giant conglomerate affiliated with Black Rock.
Increases to our already $250/mo power bill would crush our family’s finances.
Historically Blackrock has not acted in the best interest of Americans, they act in the best interest of themselves
and their shareholders. We would effectively lose control of any bargaining or control of our power comes in our
area.
I’ve watched a documentary on what this organization has done to the Yellowstone Valley in Montana, it has
devalued properties and created an environmental travesty.
This is not in the best interest of Minnesotans, especially Minnesota’s that are already being squeezed in nearly
every department by the billionaire oligarch class that runs out country.
Please do not let this happen! For the sake of all of those in northern Minnesota and greater Minnesota.
Megan Maly
